title.narrative: Hamdaniya: continuation of primary health care for

description.narrative: OCHA funded Cordaid projects in the district of Hamdaniya with 2 different grants. The first project was 50-50 funded by OCHA and Memisa. It started in June 2017 and ended in August 2018. (113890). The 2nd project started April 2018 and was fully funded by OCHA. It targeted different health facilities. It ended mid-August.(200315). Cordaid contributed to rehabilitation, running costs, capacity building, protection activities and awareness raising of in total 6 health facilities. The objective was to give returnees (minorities) primary healthcare and to encourage return of IDPs through the availability of healthcare. This has worked very well as Albert realized when he visited the health facilities and busy and bustling villages in October 2018. Community leaders, Directorate of Health (DoH) and OCHA asked Cordaid to continue support until end of December 2018. They asked it also from CEO Kees Zevenbergen last August. The Directorate of Health claims to be ready to support the health facilities all by itself in January 2019. This short project will ensure: -Proper handing over to DoH Ninawa which is on of Cordaid policies, and be sure that there will be continuation of the provision of health services. -To show to OCHA that Cordaid is committed to quality work therefore with its own funding will continue until the end of 2018. -At the moment Cordaid is talking to the Dutch MFA about a grant for Cordaid work for returnees. Having some projects will build a stronger case in dialogue with Dutch MFA on fundraising.

mailing-address.narrative: Grote Marktstraat 45, Den Haag, Zuid Holland, 2511 BH

description.narrative: Number of people benefitting directly or indirectly from activities or services established/enabled/improved within a Cordaid Health project/programme
